about.name: Stockholm
about.info_text: Stockholm, the capital of Sweden, is a beautiful and historic city spread across 14 islands in the stunning Stockholm Archipelago. Known for its clean and picturesque streets, rich history, and vibrant culture, Stockholm offers a wide range of experiences. The city is a perfect blend of old-world charm and modern innovation, with well-preserved historic sites, modern architecture, and a thriving arts and design scene.
about.facts_text:
Population: Approximately 975,000
Province: Stockholm County
Time Zone: Central European Time (UTC+1:00)
Language: Swedish
Currency: Swedish Krona (SEK)
about.climate_text: Stockholm has a temperate maritime climate with warm summers and cold winters. The best time to visit is during the summer months when the city comes alive with outdoor events and festivals.

attractions_card.title: Gamla Stan (Old Town)
attractions_card.description: Gamla Stan is Stockholm's charming old town, known for its cobblestone streets, colorful buildings, and historic landmarks, including the Royal Palace and Storkyrkan Cathedral.

attractions_card.title: Vasa Museum
attractions_card.description: The Vasa Museum is home to the remarkably well-preserved Vasa warship, a 17th-century vessel that sank on its maiden voyage and was salvaged centuries later.

attractions_card.title: Skansen Open-Air Museum
attractions_card.description: Skansen is an open-air museum and zoo that showcases traditional Swedish culture, featuring historic buildings, folk performances, and a variety of Nordic animals.

attractions_card.title: ABBA The Museum
attractions_card.description: ABBA The Museum is a tribute to the legendary Swedish pop group ABBA, where visitors can explore the band's history, music, and memorabilia.

attractions_card.title: Djurgården Island
attractions_card.description: Djurgården is a green island oasis in the heart of Stockholm, home to numerous attractions, parks, and scenic waterfront areas.

attractions_card.title: Nordic Museum
attractions_card.description: The Nordic Museum showcases the cultural history of Sweden, featuring exhibits on Swedish traditions, fashion, and design.

attractions_card.title: Stockholm City Hall
attractions_card.description: Stockholm City Hall is a historic and iconic building famous for hosting the Nobel Prize banquet. Visitors can take guided tours to explore its grand interiors.

attractions_card.title: Gröna Lund Amusement Park
attractions_card.description: Gröna Lund is an amusement park on Djurgården Island, offering thrilling rides, live concerts, and family-friendly entertainment.

food_card.title: Swedish Meatballs
food_card.description: Swedish meatballs are a classic Swedish dish, often served with lingonberry sauce, creamy gravy, and mashed potatoes.

food_card.title: Herring
food_card.description: Herring is a staple of Swedish cuisine, with various pickled herring dishes served with bread or potatoes.

food_card.title: Smörgåsbord
food_card.description: The Swedish smörgåsbord is a buffet-style meal featuring a variety of dishes, including cold and hot options, salads, and traditional delicacies.

food_card.title: Crayfish Party
food_card.description: Crayfish parties are a summer tradition in Sweden, with people gathering to enjoy freshly boiled crayfish, dill, and snaps (aquavit).

food_card.title: Princess Cake
food_card.description: Princess cake is a popular Swedish dessert consisting of layers of sponge cake, raspberry jam, vanilla custard, and green marzipan.

hotels_card.title: Grand Hôtel Stockholm
hotels_card.description: The Grand Hôtel Stockholm is a luxurious and iconic hotel overlooking the Royal Palace and Gamla Stan, offering elegant accommodations and fine dining.

hotels_card.title: Nobis Hotel
hotels_card.description: Nobis Hotel is a contemporary boutique hotel in Norrmalm, known for its modern design, stylish rooms, and central location.

hotels_card.title: At Six
hotels_card.description: At Six is a chic and art-focused hotel in the city center, featuring unique art installations, a rooftop bar, and comfortable rooms.

hotels_card.title: Sheraton Stockholm Hotel
hotels_card.description: The Sheraton Stockholm Hotel offers comfortable accommodations with stunning views of Lake Mälaren, making it an excellent choice for travelers.

hotels_card.title: Hotel Skeppsholmen
hotels_card.description: Hotel Skeppsholmen is a peaceful and historic hotel on its own island, providing a serene escape from the city's hustle and bustle.

transport_card.title: Stockholm Public Transportation
transport_card.description: Stockholm's public transportation system includes buses, trams, the metro, and ferries, offering convenient options for getting around the city.

transport_card.title: Arlanda Airport
transport_card.description: Arlanda Airport (ARN) is the largest international airport serving Stockholm, providing connections to domestic and international destinations.

transport_card.title: Stockholm Central Station
transport_card.description: Stockholm Central Station is the main railway station in the city, offering train services to other parts of Sweden and neighboring countries.

transport_card.title: Biking in Stockholm
transport_card.description: Stockholm is a bike-friendly city with dedicated bike lanes and bike-sharing programs, making it easy to explore on two wheels.
